en.Description:
USAGE:

　/record



→Opens and closes the Duty Recorder interface.

USAGE:

　/recordready [subcommand]



→Opens and closes the Duty Recorder interface.



>>Subcommands:

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>[countdowntime]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Initiate a record ready check

　　to begin recording a duty.

　　When all party members

　　consent to the recording,

　　a countdown will start at

　　the specified time.

　　Subsequent uses of this

　　command during the same

　　duty will function as both a

　　ready check and countdown.



Opens the Duty Recorder interface when no subcommand is specified.

USAGE:

　/pvpteamcmd



→Opens and closes the PvP team menu.

USAGE:

　/saddlebag



→Opens and closes your chocobo saddlebag.

USAGE:

　/magiaright



→Spins your magia board clockwise.

USAGE:

　/magialeft



→Spins your magia board counterclockwise.

ALIASES:

　/cwlinkshellcmd, /cwlcmd

USAGE:

　/cwlinkshellcmd



→Opens and closes the Cross-world Linkshell window.

ALIASES:

　/quickchat, /qchat

USAGE:

　/quickchat [quick chat message]



→Sends a Quick Chat message. Can only be used during Crystalline Conflict.



>>Example:

　/quickchat Charge <t>

　(Sends the Quick Chat message

　"Charge" using a specified

　target.)

USAGE:

　/bluespellbook [subcommand]



→Open and register active actions in the Blue Magic Spellbook.



>>Subcommands:

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>set "blue mage action" on<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Adds the specified blue

　　mage action to the list

　　of active actions in the

　　current set.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow> set "blue mage action" off<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Removes the specified blue

　　mage action from the list of

　　active actions in the current

　　set.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>preset [active set 1-5]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Load the specified set of

　　active actions.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>clear<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Remove all active actions

　　from the current active

　　action set.



Opens the Blue Magic Spellbook when no subcommand is specified.



>>Examples:

　/bluespellbook set “Water Cannon”

　(Sets the blue mage action

　Water Cannon as an active

　action in the current set.



　/bluespellbook preset 2

　(Loads active set 2.)

USAGE:

　/magiaattack [placeholder]



→Spin the magia board to match the elemental weakness of the specified target. If no target is specified, matches based on current target.



>>Common Placeholders:

　<t>, <target>, <1>-<8>



A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.

USAGE:

　/magiadefense [placeholder]



→Spin the magia board to match the elemental affinity of the specified target. If no target is specified, matches based on current target.



>>Common Placeholders:

　<t>, <target>, <1>-<8>



A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.

USAGE:

　/magiaauto [subcommand]



→Set the magia board to automatically spin based on your current target.



>>Subcommands:

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>attack (atk)<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Automatically spin the magia

　　board to match the elemental

　　weakness of current target.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>defense (def)<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Automatically spin the magia

　　board to match the elemental

　　affinity of current target.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>off <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Disable automatic spinning.



Toggle between attack, defense, and off when no subcommand is specified.

ALIASES:

　/cwlinkshell1, /cwl1

USAGE:

　/cwlinkshell1 [message]



→Sends a message to all members of the cross-world linkshell you have registered in cross-world linkshell slot 1, regardless of their location. Typing /cwlinkshell1 or /cwl1 without a message switches the default chat mode to [Cross-world Linkshell 1].

　/cwlinkshell2, /cwl2

USAGE:

　/cwlinkshell2 [message]



→Sends a message to all members of the cross-world linkshell you have registered in cross-world linkshell slot 2, regardless of their location. Typing /cwlinkshell2 or /cwl2 without a message switches the default chat mode to [Cross-world Linkshell 2].

ALIASES:

　/graphicpresets, /gpresets

USAGE:

　/graphicpresets [preset number]



→Load one of several preset graphics configuration settings.



>>Preset Configurations:

<If(Equal(PlayerParameter(78),3))>　　1: Standard (Mac)

　　2: Middle  (Mac)

　　3: High (Mac)

　　4: Extra-High (Mac)

　　5: Maximum (Mac)



>>Example:

　　/graphicpresets 2

　　=Sets graphics settings to preset 2.<Else/>　　1: Standard (Laptop)

　　2: Standard (Desktop)

　　3: High (Laptop)

　　4: High (Desktop)

　　5: Maximum



>>Example:

　　/graphicpresets 2

　　(Sets graphics settings to preset 2.)</If>

ALIASES:

　/fellowship, /fs

USAGE:

　/fellowship



→Opens and closes the Fellowship interface.

ALIASES:

　/fellowshipfinder, /fsfinder

USAGE:

　/fellowshipfinder



→Opens and closes the Fellowship Finder interface.

ALIASES:

　/collection, /coll

USAGE:

　/collection



→Opens and closes the Collection interface.

ALIASES:

　/newgame+, /ng+

USAGE:

　/newgame+



→Opens the New Game+ interface.

USAGE:

　/dice [chat mode] [subcommand]



→Displays a random number between 0 and 999 in the specified chat channel. Displays in the current chat mode when no chat mode is specified.



>>Chat Modes:

　Party

　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>party<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>, <UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>p<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　Alliance

　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>alliance<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>, <UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>al<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　Free Company

　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>freecompany<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>, <UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>fc<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　PvP Team

　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>pvpteam<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>, <UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>pt<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　Linkshell

　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>linkshell1-8<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>, <UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>l1-8<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　Cross-world Linkshell

　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>cwlinkshell1-8<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>, <UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>cwl1-8<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>



>>Subcommands:

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>[upper limit]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set an upper limit to display a random number between 1 and the specified number. Displays a random number between 0 and 999 when no upper limit is specified.

　　Upper limit range: 2-999



>>Examples:

　/dice

　(Displays a random number

　in the current chat mode.)



　/dice 16

　(Displays a random number

　between 1 and 16 in the

　current chat mode.)



　/dice cwl1

　(Displays a random number

　in the Cross-world Linkshell 1

　channel.)



　/dice cwl1 16

　(Displays a random number

　between 1 and 16 in the

　Cross-world Linkshell 1

　channel.)

USAGE:

　/nameplatetype [category] [setting number]



→Change PC display type settings.



>>Category:

　All Players

　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>all<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　Your Character

　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>self<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　Party Members

　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>party<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　Other PCs

　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>other<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　Friends

　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>friend<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　Crystalline Conflict Opponents

　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>feast<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>



>>Setting Number

　1: Full Name

　2: Surname Abbreviated

　3: Forename Abbreviated

　4: Initials



>>Example:

　/nameplatetype all 4

　(Set display names to

　initials for all players.)

USAGE:

　/nameplatedisp [category] [setting number]



→Change PC display name settings.



>>Category:

　All Players

　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>all<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　Your Character

　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>self<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　Party Members

　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>party<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　Other PCs

　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>other<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　Friends

　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>friend<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　Crystalline Conflict Opponents

　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>feast<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>



>>Setting Number

　1: Always

　2: During Battle

　3: When Targeted

　4: Never



>>Example:

　/nameplatedisp all 4

　(Set display names to never

　display for all players.)

USAGE:

　/fashion [accessory]



→Equip a specified fashion accessory.



>>Example:

　/fashion “parasol”

　(Equip the parasol accessory.)

USAGE:

　/fashionguide



→Opens and closes the Fashion Accessories interface.

ALIASES:

　/officialsite, /site

USAGE:

　/officialsite



→Opens and closes the Official Sites interface.

ALIASES:

　/petglamour, /petglam, /egiglamour

USAGE:

　/petglamour [summon] [glamour]



→Alter the appearance of select summons. You must resummon the egi for the glamour to take effect. Command not applicable in PvP instances.



>>Summon Name:

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>Carbuncle<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>Garuda-Egi<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>Titan-Egi<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>Ifrit-Egi<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>Eos<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>



>>Glamour:

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>Carbuncle<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>Emerald Carbuncle<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>Topaz Carbuncle<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>Ruby Carbuncle<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>Garuda-Egi<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>Titan-Egi<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>Ifrit-Egi<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>Selene<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>



The glamour will be removed when no glamour is specified.

Displays pet glamour settings in chat log when no subcommand is specified.



>>Example:

　/petglamour "Garuda-Egi" "Ruby Carbuncle"

　(Garuda-Egi will appear glamoured as Ruby Carbuncle.)

　/petglamour "Garuda-Egi"

　(Returns Garuda-Egi to default appearance.)

　/petglamour

　(Displays pet glamour settings.)

USAGE:

　/petsize [summon] [size]



→Alter the size of select summons. Command not applicable in PvP instances. These settings will not apply to other players.



>>Egi Name:

　Demi-Bahamut

　Demi-Phoenix

　Ruby Ifrit

　Topaz Titan

　Emerald Garuda

　all



>>Size:

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>large<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set summon size to large.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>medium<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set summon size to medium.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>small<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set summon size to small.



Toggles between small, medium, and large when no size is specified. Returns an error when attempting to toggle using “all.”



>>Example:

　/petsize "Ruby Ifrit" "small"

　(Set Ruby Ifrit's size to small.)

USAGE:

　/ridepillion [placeholder] [subcommand]



→Ride pillion on a selected party member's mount.



>>Subcommands:

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>[seat number]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Select your desired seat on the mount.

　　Available options: 1-7



>>Common Placeholders:

　<t>, <target>, <1>-<8>



If the desired seat is already selected, you will be placed in the next available seat. Seat 1 will be selected if unspecified.



>>Example:

　/ridepillion <2> 1

　(Ride in seat 1 of party member 2.)

USAGE:

　/patchnote



→Opens the Patch Notes page on the official site.



Launches using your default browser.

USAGE:

　/portrait



→Opens and closes the Portraits interface.

ALIASES:

　/adventurerplate, /myplate

USAGE:

　/myplate



→Opens and closes your adventurer plate.

USAGE:

　/rclickpc [subcommand]



→Sets right-click selection to allow or ignore PC targets.



>>Subcommands:

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>on <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Disables right-click selection for PCs.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>off <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Enables right-click selection for PCs.



Toggles between on and off when no subcommand is specified.

USAGE:

　/rclickbattlenpc [subcommand]



→Sets right-click selection to allow or ignore battle NPC targets.



>>Subcommands:

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>on <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Disables right-click selection for battle NPCs.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>off <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Enables right-click selection for battle NPCs.



Toggles between on and off when no subcommand is specified.

USAGE:

　/rclickminion [subcommand]



→Sets right-click selection to allow or ignore minion targets.



>>Subcommands:

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>on <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Disables right-click selection for minions.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>off <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Enables right-click selection for minions.



Toggles between on and off when no subcommand is specified.

ALIASES:

　/pvpteam, /pt

USAGE:

　/pvpteam [message]



→Sends a message to all members of your PvP team, regardless of their location. Typing /pvpteam or /pt without a message switches the default chat mode to [PvP Team].



>>Examples:

　 /pvpteam Hello

　(Sends the message "Hello"

　to your PvP team.)



　/pvpteam

　(Switches the default chat

　mode to [PvP Team].)

ALIASES:

　/cwlinkshell, /cwl

USAGE:

　/cwlinkshell [message]



→Sends a message to all members of your active cross-world linkshell, regardless of their location. Typing /cwlinkshell or /cwl without a message switches the default chat mode to your active cross-world linkshell channel.

ALIASES:

　/novice, /n

USAGE:

　/novice [message]



→Sends a message to the [Novice Network]. The message will not be displayed if a PC has deselected [Novice Network] in the chat filter. Typing /novice or /n without a message switches the default chat mode to [Novice Network].



>>Examples:

　 /novice Hello

　(Sends the message "Hello"

　to the Novice Network.)



　/novice

　(Switches the default chat

　mode to [Novice Network].)

ALIASES:

　/say, /s

USAGE:

　/say [message]



→Sends a message to all PCs within a small radius. The message will not be displayed if a PC has deselected [Say] in the chat filter. Typing /say or /s without a message switches the default chat mode to [Say].

ALIASES:

　/shout, /sh

USAGE:

　/shout [message]



→Sends a message to all PCs in the same area. The message will not be displayed if a PC has deselected [Shout] in the chat filter.

ALIASES:

　/tell, /t

USAGE:

　/tell [PC name]@[World name] [message]



→Sends a message to a specific PC on a specified World. When specifying a World other than your own, the message can only be sent to PCs that are on your friend list or recruiting party members via the Party Finder. This message cannot be seen by other PCs, and will not be displayed if [Tell] is deselected in the chat filter. Typing /tell or /t [PC name]@[World name] without a message switches the default chat mode to [Tell].



>>Example:

　/tell [PC name]@Bahamut Hello

　(Sends the message "Hello" to

　[PC name] on the World

　Bahamut.)

ALIASES:

　/party, /p

USAGE:

　/party [message]



→Sends a message to all members of your current party, regardless of their location. The message will not be displayed if a PC has deselected [Party] in the chat filter. Typing /party or /p without a message switches the default chat mode to [Party].

ALIASES:

　/linkshell, /l

USAGE:

　/linkshell [message]



→Sends a message to all members of your active linkshell, regardless of their location. Typing /linkshell or /l without a message switches the default chat mode to [Linkshell].

ALIASES:

　/linkshell1, /l1

USAGE:

　/linkshell1 [message]



→Sends a message to all members of the linkshell you have registered in linkshell slot 1, regardless of their location.

ALIASES:

　/linkshell2, /l2

USAGE:

　/linkshell2 [message]



→Sends a message to all members of the linkshell you have registered in linkshell slot 2, regardless of their location.

ALIASES:

　/linkshell3, /l3

USAGE:

　/linkshell3 [message]



→Sends a message to all members of the linkshell you have registered in linkshell slot 3, regardless of their location.

ALIASES:

　/linkshell4, /l4

USAGE:

　/linkshell4 [message]



→Sends a message to all members of the linkshell you have registered in linkshell slot 4, regardless of their location.

ALIASES:

　/linkshell5, /l5

USAGE:

　/linkshell5 [message]



→Sends a message to all members of the linkshell you have registered in linkshell slot 5, regardless of their location.

ALIASES:

　/linkshell6, /l6

USAGE:

　/linkshell6 [message]



→Sends a message to all members of the linkshell you have registered in linkshell slot 6, regardless of their location.

ALIASES:

　/linkshell7, /l7

USAGE:

　/linkshell7 [message]



→Sends a message to all members of the linkshell you have registered in linkshell slot 7, regardless of their location.

ALIASES:

　/linkshell8, /l8

USAGE:

　/linkshell8 [message]



→Sends a message to all members of the linkshell you have registered in linkshell slot 8, regardless of their location.

ALIASES:

　/freecompany, /fc

USAGE:

　/freecompany [message]



→Sends a message to all members of your free company, regardless of their location. Typing /freecompany or /fc without a message switches the default chat mode to [Free Company].

ALIASES:

　/echo, /e

USAGE:

　/echo [message]



→Displays a message that only you can see.

ALIASES:

　/yell, /y

USAGE:

　/yell [message]



→Sends a message to all PCs within a large radius. The message will not be displayed if a PC has deselected [Yell] in the chat filter. Typing /yell or /y without a message switches the default chat mode to [Yell].

ALIASES:

　/reply, /r

USAGE:

　/r [message]



→Sends a message to the last player from whom you received a /tell.

ALIASES:

　/alliance, /a

USAGE:

　/alliance [message]



→Sends a message to all members of your current alliance, regardless of their location. The message will not be displayed if a PC has deselected [Alliance] in the chat filter. Typing /alliance or /a without a message switches the default chat mode to [Alliance].

USAGE:

　/join



→Accepts a party invite.

USAGE:

　/decline



→Declines a party invite.

USAGE:

　/invite [placeholder]



→Invites the specified PC to your party. Invites current target when no PC is specified.



>>Common Placeholders:

　<t>, <target>, <1>-<8>



A full list of Placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.

USAGE:

　/kick [placeholder]



→Kicks the specified PC from your party. Kicks current target when no PC is specified.



>>Common Placeholders:

　<t>, <target>, <1>-<8>



A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.

USAGE:

　/leader [placeholder]



→Promotes the specified PC to party leader. Promotes current target when no PC is specified.



>>Common Placeholders:

　<t>, <target>, <1>-<8>



A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.

USAGE:

　/leave



→Leave your current party.

ALIASES:

　/check, /c

USAGE:

　/check [placeholder]



→Examines the specified PC. Examines current target when no PC is specified.



>>Common Placeholders:

　<t>, <target>, <1>-<8>



A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.

USAGE:

　/trade [placeholder]



→Initiates a trade with the specified PC. Initiates a trade with your current target when no PC is specified.



>>Common Placeholders:

　<t>, <target>, <1>-<8>



A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.

USAGE:

　/automove [subcommand]



→Begin moving in the current direction you are facing.



>>Subcommands:

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>on <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>    Initiate automove.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>off <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>    Cancel automove.



Toggle between on and off when no subcommand is specified.

USAGE:

　/follow



→Automatically follow a specified PC. Follow current target when no PC is specified.

USAGE:

　/meldrequest [placeholder]



→Sends a materia meld request to the specified PC. Sends request to current target when no PC is specified.



>>Common Placeholders:

　<t>, <target>, <1>-<8>



A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.

ALIASES:

　/partycmd, /pcmd

USAGE:

　/partycmd [subcommand]



→Executes various party commands. Can only be used to display the Party menu or add party members when participating in a cross-world party.



>>Subcommands:

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>join<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Accept a party invite.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>decline<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Decline a party invite.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>add [placeholder]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Invite a PC to your party.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>leave<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Leave your current party.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>kick [placeholder]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Oust a PC from your party.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>breakup <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Dissolve your current party.



Opens and closes the Party menu when no subcommand is specified.



>>Common Placeholders:

　<t>, <target>, <1>-<8>



A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.

ALIASES:

　/friendlist, /flist

USAGE:

　/friendlist [subcommand]



→Executes various friend list commands.



>>Subcommands:

  <UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>add [placeholder]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Send a PC a friend request.

  <UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>accept [placeholder]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Accept a friend request from

　　a PC.

  <UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>deny [placeholder]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Deny a friend request from a

　　PC.

  <UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>remove [placeholder]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Remove a PC from your

　　friend list.



Opens and closes friend list when no subcommand is specified.



>>Common Placeholders:

　<t>, <target>, <1>-<8>



A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.

　/blacklist, /blist

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>remove [placeholder]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Remove a PC from your

　　blacklist.



Opens and closes blacklist when no subcommand is specified.

　<t>, <target>, <1>-<8>



A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.

ALIASES:

　/search, /sea

USAGE:

　/search [condition]



→Executes a player search based on the conditions given. Multiple conditions should be separated with a space. Conducts default search if no conditions are specified.



>>Conditions:

【PC Name】

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>forename "PC name"<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Search for a specific first

　　name.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>surname "PC name"<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Search for a specific last

　　name.

<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>　off<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>/<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>clear<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>      Turns off sign.

ALIASES:

　/waymark, /wmark

USAGE:

　/wmark [subcommand] [placeholder]



→Place a waymark on the ground below a target. If no target is specified, you will enter ground targeting mode ready to place a waymark.



>>Subcommands:

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>a <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Place or remove waymark A. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>b <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Place or remove waymark B. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>c <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Place or remove waymark C. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>d<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Place or remove waymark D. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>1<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Place or remove waymark 1. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>2<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Place or remove waymark 2. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>3<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Place or remove waymark 3. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>4<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Place or remove waymark 4. Overwrites existing waymark if target is specified.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow> off<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>/<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>clear<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Remove all waymarks.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>save 1-30<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Save waymark placements to slots 1-30 of the Waymarks menu.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>preset 1-30<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Load waymark placements from slots 1-30 of the Waymarks menu.



You will enter ground targeting mode ready to place an unused waymark in the order of A-D, 1, 2 when no subcommand is specified. More than six waymarks cannot be placed at one time. If a target name is specified, a marker name must also be specified.



>>Common Placeholders:

　<t>, <target>, <1>-<8>, gtoff



A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.



>>Examples:

　/waymark A

　(Enters ground targeting

　mode ready to place

　waymark A.)



　/waymark A <t>

　(Places waymark A at the

　selected target's location.)



　/waymark A gtoff

　(Places waymark A at the

　mouse cursor's location.)

　　If the icon name is a

　/recast "action name"



→Displays time remaining until the specified action can be used again.

ALIASES:

　/gearset, /gs

USAGE:

　/gearset [subcommand]



→Execute gear set functions.



>>Subcommands:

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>change [number 1] [number 2] <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Equip gear in slot [number].

　　A gear set name can be

　　specified in place of a slot

　　number. If glamour plates

　　are available, a plate

　　number can also be

　　specified.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>view [number] <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　List gear in slot [number].

　　A gear set name can be

　　specified in place of a slot

　　number.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>save [number] <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Save current gear to slot

　　[number]. A gear set name

　　can be specified in place

　　of a slot number.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>delete [number] <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Delete slot [number]. A

　　gear set name can be

　　specified in place of a slot

　　number.



First letter matching can be used when specifying gear sets by name.

Gear sets will be searched in order from lowest slot number to highest.

Gear set list will be displayed when no subcommand is specified.



>>Example:

　/gearset change 1 1

　(Equip gear in slot 1 and

　cast glamour from plate 1.)

　/gearset change warrior

　(Equip gear slot whose

　name begins with warrior.)

　　/itemsort, /isort

USAGE:

→Sorts your inventory based on the conditions given. This command does not affect the Sort function.



>>Subcommands:

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>condition [Category]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>execute [Category]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Sorts the specified items

　　based on the conditions

　　given.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>clear [Category]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Clears sort conditions for the

　　specified item category.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>asc<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>, <UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>des<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>



Defaults to ascending if order is not specified. Retainer and saddlebag inventories must be open when specified as categories. Cannot be used if one of the conditions is "tab".



>>Examples:

　/isort condition mh lv asc

　(Sets main arms to be sorted

　by ascending equipping level.)



　/itemsort condition mh ilv des

　(Sets main arms to be sorted

　by descending item level.)



　/itemsort execute mh

　(Sorts main arms based on

　the above conditions.)

→Conducts a complete search of your inventory for all items you own, including equipped gear, items held or equipped by retainers, and items stored in your Armoury Chest, saddlebag, armoire, and glamour dresser. Command cannot be used in a macro.

　(Searches your inventory for

　items containing the word

　Potion.)

ALIASES:

USAGE:

　/icam [placeholder]



→Activate the idling camera. Target does not need to be specified. If a target is specified, the camera will switch between camera angles focusing on that target. If the specified target cannot be focused on, then a random subject will be chosen.

　Open the Camera Settings interface

　<CommandIcon(10)/>, <If(Equal(PlayerParameter(78),3))>r<Else/>R</If>, NUM*, Wheel Button



　Pause/unpause camera

　<CommandIcon(8)/>, NUM0, left-click



　Skip scene

　<CommandIcon(6)/>, <If(Equal(PlayerParameter(78),3))>tab,shift+tab<Else/>Tab,Shift+Tab</If>



　Adjust frame composition

　<CommandIcon(20)/>, <If(Equal(PlayerParameter(78),3))>w,a,s,d,q,e<Else/>W,A,S,D,Q,E</If>



　Reset frame composition

　<Gui(16)/>, <If(Equal(PlayerParameter(78),3))>z<Else/>Z</If>



>>Common Placeholders:

　<t>, <target>, <1>-<8>



A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.

USAGE:

　/alarm "name" [clock type] [repeat] [time] [reminder]



→Set an alarm for a specified time using local, server, or Eorzea time.



>>Clock Type:

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>lt<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the alarm using local time.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>st<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the alarm using server time.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>et<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the alarm using Eorzea time.



>>Repeat:

　Use "repeat" or "rp" to set an hourly alarm.



>>Time:

　Times must be set using the 24-hour clock.

　Time values: 0000-2400

　The hour must be omitted when using the repeat subcommand.



>>Reminder:

　A notification can be given up to 60 minutes prior to the alarm.

　Time values: 0-60



The repeat and reminder subcommands can be omitted.

The "clear" subcommand can be used to delete all alarms.

Opens the alarm interface when no subcommands are specified.



>>Examples:

　/alarm Raid lt 2000 10

　(Sets the "Raid" alarm for

　20:00 local time, with a

　notification given 10

　minutes prior.)



　/alarm Party lt rp 30

　(Sets the "Party" alarm as

　an hourly alarm, 30 minutes

　past the hour in local time.)

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>off <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>    Set your status to Online.



Toggle between Role-playing and Online when no subcommand is specified.

ALIASES:

　/action, /ac

USAGE:

　/action "action name" [placeholder]



→Uses an action on the specified PC. Uses current target when not specified. Target does not need to be specified for certain actions. This cannot be used with actions you have not yet learned, or when restricted by other factors. If action uses ground targeting, then the action will be executed according to the specified placeholder. If no placeholder is specified, then you will enter ground targeting mode.



>>Common Placeholders:

　<t>, <target>, <1>-<8>, gtoff



A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.



>>Examples:

　/action "Heavy Swing" <t>

　(Executes Heavy Swing

　on current target.)



　/action "Cure" <2>

　(Executes Cure on second

　player in party list.)

　/action "Earthly Star" gtoff

　(Executes Earthly Star at

　mouse cursor's location.)

ALIASES:

　/battlemode, /bm

USAGE:

　/battlemode [subcommand]



→Toggle between active and passive mode.



>>Subcommands:

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>on <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>    Switch to active mode.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>off <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>    Switch to passive mode.



Toggle between active and passive mode when no subcommand is specified.

ALIASES:

　/target, /ta

USAGE:

　/target [placeholder]



→Targets the specified PC. Target must be within a certain radius for this command to function.



>>Common Placeholders:

　<t>, <target>, <1>-<8>



A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.



>>Example:

　/target <2>

　(Targets second player

　in player list.)

ALIASES:

　/targetpc, /tpc

USAGE:

　/targetpc



→Targets the closest PC within a certain radius.

ALIASES:

　/targetnpc, /tnpc

USAGE:

　/targetnpc



→Targets the closest NPC within a certain radius.

ALIASES:

　/targetenemy, /tenemy

USAGE:

　/targetenemy



→Targets the closest enemy within a certain radius.

ALIASES:

　/battletarget, /bt

USAGE:

　/battletarget



→Targets the closest enemy within a certain radius that is attacking you.

ALIASES:

　/assist, /as

USAGE:

　/assist [placeholder]



→Targets the target of another PC. Assists current target when none is specified.



>>Common Placeholders:

　<t>, <target>, <1>-<8>



A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.

ALIASES:

　/facetarget, /ft

USAGE:

　/facetarget



→Immediately turns your PC in the direction of your current target.

ALIASES:

　/nexttarget, /nt

USAGE:

　/nexttarget



→Toggle clockwise through on-screen enemies.

USAGE:

　/previoustarget



→Toggle counterclockwise through on-screen enemies.

ALIASES:

　/targetlasttarget, /tlt

USAGE:

　/targetlasttarget



→Re-target your last target.

ALIASES:

　/targetlastenemy, /tle

USAGE:

　/targetlastenemy



→Re-target the last enemy you targeted.

ALIASES:

　/lockon, /lo

USAGE:

　/lockon [subcommand]



→Lock on/off current target.



>>Subcommands:

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>on <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>     Enable lock-on.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>off <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>    Disable lock-on.



Toggle between on/off when no subcommand is specified.

USAGE:

　/focustarget [placeholder]



→Makes the specified PC your focus target. Makes current target your focus target when none specified.



>>Common Placeholders:

　<t>, <target>, <1>-<8>



A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.



>>Example:

　/focustarget <t>

　(Makes current target

　your focus target.)

ALIASES:

　/petaction, /pac

USAGE:

　/pac "pet action name" [placeholder]



→Uses a pet action on the specified target. Uses current target when not specified. Target does not need to be specified for certain pet actions. This cannot be used with pet actions you have not yet learned, or when restricted by other factors.



>>Common Placeholders:

　<t>, <target>, <1>-<8>



A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.



>>Example:

 　/pac "Crimson Cyclone" <t>

　(Executes Crimson Cyclone

　on current target.)

ALIASES:

　/companionaction, /cac

USAGE:

　/cac "companion action name"



→Uses a companion action. The target of companion actions cannot be specified. This cannot be used with companion actions you have not yet learned, or when restricted by other factors.



>>Example:

　/cac "free stance"

　(Companion will enter

　free stance.)

ALIASES:

　/facecamera, /fcam

USAGE:

　/facecamera



→Gaze continuously at the camera. Execute command again to cancel.

ALIASES:

　/levelsync, /lsync

USAGE:

　/levelsync [subcommand]



→Sync your level when the option is available, such as during FATEs.



>>Subcommands:

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>on <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>     Start level sync.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>off <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>    End level sync.



Toggle between on and off when no subcommand is specified.

USAGE:

　/mount "mount name"



→Summon or dismiss the specified mount. Mount name is not necessary when dismissing.



>>Example:

　/mount "Company Chocobo"

　(Summons or dismisses your

　company chocobo.)

ALIASES:

　/additionalaction, /aaction

USAGE:

　/aaction "action name" [subcommand]



A command previously believed to set the specified action as an additional action for your current gatherer class.

※This text command is no longer in use.

ALIASES:

　/generalaction, /gaction

USAGE:

　/gaction "action name" [placeholder]



→Uses the specified general action on the specified target. If action uses ground targeting, then the action will be executed according to the specified placeholder. If no placeholder is specified, then you will enter ground targeting mode.



>>Common Placeholders:

　<t>, <target>, <1>-<8>, gtoff



A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.



>>Examples:

　/gaction "Mount Roulette"

　(Executes the Mount Roulette.)



　/gaction “Duty Action I” <t>

　(Executes a duty-specific action

　on the specified target.)

USAGE:

　/minion "minion name"



→Summon or dismiss the specified minion. Minion name is not necessary when dismissing.



>>Example:

　/minion "wayward hatchling"

　(Summons or dismisses the

　wayward hatchling minion.)

USAGE:

　/statusoff "status"



→Removes designated beneficial status.



>>Example:

　/statusoff "Bloodbath"

　(Removes Bloodbath.)

ALIASES:

　/addpvpaction, /apa

A command previously believed to set specified actions as additional PvP actions.

※This text command is no longer in use.

　/pvpaction "action name" [placeholder]



→Uses the specified PvP action on the specified target. Uses current target when not specified. Target does not need to be specified for certain actions. This cannot be used with PvP actions you have not yet learned or when restricted by other factors. If action uses ground targeting, then the action will be executed according to the specified placeholder. If no placeholder is specified, then you will enter ground targeting mode.



>>Common Placeholders:

　<t>, <target>, <1>-<8>, gtoff



A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.



>>Example:

　/pvpaction "Storm's Path" <t>

　(Executes Storm's Path

　on current target.)

USAGE:

　/blueaction “blue mage action” [placeholder]



→Uses the specified blue magic action on the specified target. Uses current target when not specified. Target does not need to be specified for certain actions. This cannot be used with actions you have not yet learned, or when restricted by other factors. If action uses ground targeting, then the action will be executed according to the specified placeholder. If no placeholder is specified, then you will enter ground targeting mode.



>>Common Placeholders:

　<t>, <target>, <1>-<8>, gtoff



A full list of placeholders can be found on the Lodestone Play Guide.



>>Example:

　/blueaction “Water Cannon” <t>

　(Executes Water Cannon on

　the specified target.)

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>off <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>       Disable auto-face.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>off <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>      Hide target ring.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>off <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>      Hide target lines.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>off <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>      Disable clicking on self.

Toggle between on/off when no subcommand is specified.

USAGE:

　/chatlog [subcommand]



→Configure log window settings.



>>Subcommands:

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>name [number 0-3]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Change the way names are

　　displayed in your log window.

　　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>0<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> Full Name

　　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>1<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> Last Name Initialed

　　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>2<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> First Name Initialed

　　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>3<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> Initials Only

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>fontsize [tab number] [number]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Adjust [tab number] log

　　window font size to

　　[number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>time [tab number] on<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Add time stamps to all

　　messages on [tab number]

　　log window.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>time [tab number] off<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Remove time stamps from all

　　messages on [tab number]

　　log window.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>time [tab number]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Toggle time stamps on/off

　　for all messages on

　　[tab number] log window.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>time 12 <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set time display to 12-hour

　　format.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>time 24 <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set time display to 24-hour

　　format.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>time local <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set time stamp clock to local

　　time.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>time server <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set time stamp clock to server

　　time.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>call on <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Play sound upon receiving

　　/tell.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>call off <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Play no sound upon receiving

　　/tell.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>call [chat channel]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Toggle /tell sound on/off for

　　the specified chat channel.

　　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>emote<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> Emote

　　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>t<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> Tell

　　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>p<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> Party

　　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>fc<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> Free Company

　　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>al<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> Alliance

　　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>l1-8<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> Linkshell 1-8

　　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>new<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> Novice Network

　　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>pvpteam<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> PvP Team

　　　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>cwl<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> Cross-world Linkshell

ALIASES:

　/battleeffect, /bfx

USAGE:

　/bfx [subcommand] [setting]



→Configure battle effects settings.



>>Subcommands:

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>self <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Configure own battle effects

　　settings.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>party <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Configure party members'

　　battle effects settings.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>other <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Configure other NPCs' battle

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>enemypc <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Configure PvP combatants'

　　battle effects settings.



>>Settings:

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>all <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>           Show all effects.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>simple <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>   Show limited effects.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>off <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>          Hide all effects.



Toggles between all and off when no setting is specified.

Toggle between on/off when no subcommand is specified.

USAGE:

　/hotbar [subcommand]



→Edit and configure hotbar settings. Only available in PvE areas.



>>Subcommands

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>action "action name" [#1] [#2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified action to slot [#2] in hotbar page [#1]. If "current" is entered for [#1], then the action will be set in the page displayed in hotbar 1. If [#2] is omitted, the action will be set to the lowest-numbered slot available. If both [#1] and [#2] are omitted, the action will be set to the lowest-numbered slot available on the lowest-numbered hotbar available. This applies to all of the following subcommands.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>blueaction "blue mage action name" [#1] [#2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified blue mage action to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].

 　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>general "general action name" [#1] [#2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified general action to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>item "item name" [#1] [#2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified item to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>emote "emote name" [#1] [#2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified emote to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>companion "companion action name" [#1] [#2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified companion action to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>pet "action name" [#1] [#2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified pet action to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>minion "minion name" [#1] [#2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified minion to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>mount "mount name" [#1] [#2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified mount to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>enemysign "enemy sign name" [#1] [#2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified enemy sign to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>waymark "waymark name" [#1] [#2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified waymark to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>change [number]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Replace current hotbar with hotbar [number].  If "next" or "prev" is entered in [number], then you can scroll through the pages of hotbar 1.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>copy [class 1] [#1] [class 2] [#2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Copy the contents of [class 1] hotbar [#1] to the [class 2] hotbar [#2].

　　The subcommand "current" can be used to specify your current class.

　　The subcommand "share" can be used instead of a class to specify your shared hotbar.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>display [number] on<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Display hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>display [number] off<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Hide hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>display [number]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Toggle on/off hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>share [number] on<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Make hotbar [number] shared.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>share [number] off<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Unshare hotbar [number] and assign it to your current class/job.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>share [number]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Toggle between on/off.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>remove [#1] [#2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Remove the action assigned to slot [#2] on hotbar [#1].

　　Replace [#2] with "all" to remove all actions from hotbar [#1].



>>Examples:

　/hotbar action "Mount

　Roulette" 1 1

　(Places Mount Roulette in

　slot [#1] on hotbar [#1].)



　/hotbar change 2

　(Replaces hotbar [#1] with

　hotbar [#2].)

ALIASES:

　/crosshotbar, /chotbar

USAGE:

　/crosshotbar [subcommand]



→Edit and configure cross hotbar settings. Only available in PvE areas.



>>Subcommands

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>set "action name" [number] [slot name]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified action to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number]. If "current" is entered for [number], the action will be set in the currently displayed hotbar. If [slot name] is omitted, the action will be set to the lowest-numbered slot available. If both [number] and [slot name] are omitted, the action will be set to the lowest-numbered slot available on the lowest-numbered cross hotbar available. This applies to all of the following subcommands.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>blueaction "blue mage action name" [number] [slot name]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified blue mage action to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>general "general action name" [number] [slot name]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified general action to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>item "item name" [number] [slot name]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified item to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>emote "emote name" [number] [slot name]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified emote to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>companion "companion action name" [number] [slot name]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified companion action to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>pet "action name" [number] [slot name]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified pet action to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>minion "minion name" [number] [slot name]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified minion to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>mount "mount name" [number] [slot name]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified mount to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>enemysign "enemy sign name" [number] [slot name]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified enemy sign to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>waymark "waymark name" [number] [slot name]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified waymark to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>change [number]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Replace current cross hotbar with cross hotbar [number]. Enter "prev" or "next" for [number] to scroll through the cross hotbars.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>copy [class 1] [number 1] [class 2] [number 2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Copy the contents of [class 1] cross hotbar [number 1] to the [class 2] cross hotbar [number 2].

　　The subcommand "current" can be used to specify your current class.

　　The subcommand "share" can be used instead of a class to specify your shared hotbar.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>display [number] on<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Display cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>display [number] off<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Hide cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>display [number]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Toggle on/off cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>share [number] on<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Make cross hotbar [number] shared.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>share [number] off<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Unshare cross hotbar [number] and assign it to your current class/job.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>share [number]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Toggle between on/off.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>remove [number] [slot name]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Remove the action assigned to [slot name] on cross hotbar [number]. Replace [slot name] with "all" to remove all actions from cross hotbar [number].

USAGE:

　/hudreset



→Reverts the current HUD layout, size, and transparency to the default settings.

USAGE:

　/uireset



→Reverts all HUD layouts to the default setting, and returns all windows to their default positions, sizes, and transparencies.

USAGE:

　/uiscale [subcommand]



→Resize current HUD elements and windows.



>>Subcommands:

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>[number] <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>      Resize all HUD elements and windows to the percentage equivalent to the number specified. Percentages available: 60, 80, 90, 100, 110, 120, 140.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>reset <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>      Reset all HUD elements to default size.



>>Examples:

　/uiscale 140

　(All HUD elements become

　40 percent larger than their

　default size.)

　/uiscale reset

　(Restores all HUD elements

　to their default size.)

>>Subcommands:

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>on <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>　　Display cross hotbar.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>off <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>　　Hide cross hotbar.



Toggle between on and off when no subcommand is specified.

USAGE:

　/pvphotbar [subcommand]



→Edit and configure hotbar settings. This command can only be used with the PvP hotbar.



>>Subcommands

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>action "action name" [#1] [#2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified PvP action to slot [#2] in hotbar page [#1]. If "current" is entered for [#1], then the action will be set in the page displayed in hotbar 1. If [#2] is omitted, the action will be set to the lowest-numbered slot available. If both [#1] and [#2] are omitted, the action will be set to the lowest-numbered slot available on the lowest-numbered hotbar available. This applies to all of the following subcommands.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>general "general action name" [#1] [#2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified general action to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>item "item name" [#1] [#2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified item to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>emote "emote name" [#1] [#2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified emote to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>companion "companion action name" [#1] [#2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified companion action to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>pet "action name" [#1] [#2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified pet action to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>minion "minion name" [#1] [#2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified minion to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>mount "mount name" [#1] [#2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified mount to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>enemysign "enemy sign name" [#1] [#2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified enemy sign to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>waymark "waymark name" [#1] [#2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified waymark to slot [#2] in hotbar [#1].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>change [number]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Replace current hotbar with hotbar [number].  If "next" or "prev" is entered in [number], then you can scroll through the pages of hotbar 1.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>copy [job 1] [#1] [job 2] [#2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Copy the contents of [job 1] hotbar [#1] to the [job 2] hotbar [#2].

　　The subcommand "current" can be used to specify your current job.

　　The subcommand "share" can be used instead of a job to specify your shared hotbar.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>display [number] on<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Display hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>display [number] off<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Hide hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>display [number]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Toggle on/off hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>share [number] on<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Make hotbar [number] shared.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>share [number] off<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Unshare hotbar [number] and assign it to your current job.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>share [number]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Toggle between on/off.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>remove [#1] [#2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Remove the action assigned to slot [#2] on hotbar [#1].

　　Replace [#2] with "all" to remove all actions from hotbar [#1].



>>Examples:

　/pvphotbar action "Purify" 1 1

　(Places Purify in slot [#1]

　on hotbar [#1].)



　/pvphotbar change 2

　(Replaces PvP hotbar [#1]

　with PvP hotbar [#2].)

ALIASES:

　/pvpcrosshotbar, /pvpchotbar

USAGE:

　/pvpcrosshotbar [subcommand]



→Edit and configure cross hotbar settings. This command can only be used with the PvP cross hotbar.



>>Subcommands

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>set "action name" [number] [slot name]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified PvP action to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number]. If "current" is entered for [number], the action will be set in the currently displayed cross hotbar. If [slot name] is omitted, the action will be set to the lowest-numbered slot available. If both [number] and [slot name] are omitted, the action will be set to the lowest-numbered slot available on the lowest-numbered cross hotbar available. This applies to all of the following subcommands.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>general "general action name" [number] [slot name]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified general action to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>item "item name" [number] [slot name]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified item to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>emote "emote name" [number] [slot name]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified emote to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>companion "companion action name" [number] [slot name]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified companion action to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>pet "action name" [number] [slot name]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified pet action to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>minion "minion name" [number] [slot name]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified minion to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>mount "mount name" [number] [slot name]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified mount to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>enemysign "enemy sign name" [number] [slot name]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified enemy sign to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>waymark "waymark name" [number] [slot name]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Set the specified waymark to [slot name] in cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>change [number]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Replace current cross hotbar with cross hotbar [number]. Enter "prev" or "next" for [number] to scroll through the cross hotbars.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>copy [job 1] [number 1] [job 2] [number 2]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Copy the contents of [job 1] cross hotbar [number 1] to the [job 2] cross hotbar [number 2].

　　The subcommand "current" can be used to specify your current job.

　　The subcommand "share" can be used instead of a job to specify your shared cross hotbar.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>display [number] on<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Display cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>display [number] off<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Hide cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>display [number]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Toggle on/off cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>share [number] on<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Make cross hotbar [number] shared.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>share [number] off<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Unshare cross hotbar [number] and assign it to your current job.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>share [number]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Toggle between on/off.

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>remove [number] [slot name]<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

　　Remove the action assigned to [slot name] on cross hotbar [number]. Replace [slot name] with "all" to remove all actions from cross hotbar [number].

　<UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>off <UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>

de.Description:
/rückblende, /rück, /record

→ Öffnet das Rückblendenmenü.

/rückbereit, /rb, /recordready

VERWENDUNG:

/rückbereit [Zahl]

→ Sendet eine Bereitschaftsanfrage für die Rückblende und startet den Inhalt nach einem Countdown von 5-30 Sekunden, nachdem alle ihre Bereitschaft erklärt haben.

Bei fehlendem Unterbefehl wird das Menü für die Bereitschaftsanfrage (Rückblende) geöffnet.

/pvpteammenü, /tm, /pvpteamcmd

→ Öffnet das PvP-Team-Menü.

/satteltasche, /st, /chocobag

→ Zeigt den Inhalt der Chocobo-Satteltasche an.

/magiarechts, /mr, /magiaright

→ Dreht die Magia-Tafel im Uhrzeigersinn.

/magialinks, /ml, /magialeft

→ Dreht die Magia-Tafel gegen den Uhrzeigersinn.

/wkkmenü, /wkkm, /cwlinkshellcmd, /cwlcmd

→ Öffnet und schließt das Menüfenster deines Welten-Kontaktkreises.

/schnellchat, /schat, /quickchat, /qchat

VERWENDUNG:

/schnellchat [Chat-Nachricht]

→ Sendet eine schnelle Chat-Nachricht. Kann nur während „Crystalline Conflict“ benutzt werden.



Beispiel:

/schnellchat Angriff

Sendet die Nachricht „Angriff“ an die Teammitglieder.

/schnellchat <t> Angriff

Bittet Teammitglieder, das aktuell anvisierte Ziel anzugreifen.

/blaumagie, /blaum, /bluespellbook

VERWENDUNG:

/blaumagie [Unterbefehl]

→ Aktiviert ein Blaumagie-Kommando.

>>Unterbefehle:

  <UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>legen<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> (set) [Kommando] Aktiviert oder deaktiviert das genannte Blaumagie-Kommando.

  <UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>legen<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> (set) [Kommando] <UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>ein<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> (on) Aktiviert das genannte Blaumagie-Kommando.

  <UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>legen<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> (set) [Kommando] <UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>aus<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> (off) Deaktiviert das genannte Blaumagie-Kommando.

  <UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>aktivset<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> (preset) [Aktivset-Nummer] (1-5)

 Aktiviert das bezeichnete Aktivset.

  <UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>zurück<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> (clear) Deaktiviert alle Kommandos des aktiven Sets.

Bei fehlendem Unterbefehl wird das Zauberbuch der Blaumagie geöffnet.

>>Beispiel:

/blaumagie legen Wasserkanone

Aktiviert oder deaktiviert das Kommando „Wasserkanone“.

/blaumagie aktivset 2

Aktiviert das Aktivset 2.

/magiaoffensiv, /magiaoff, /magiaattack

VERWENDUNG:

/magiaoffensiv [Ziel]

→ Stellt die Magia-Tafel entgegengesetzt zur elementaren Affinität des benannten Zieles ein.

>>Beispiel:

/magiaoffensiv <t>

Stellt die Magia-Tafel entgegengesetzt zur elementaren Affinität des anvisierten Zieles ein.

/magiadefensiv, /magiadef, /magiadefense

VERWENDUNG:

/defensiv [Ziel]

→ Stellt die Magia-Tafel passend zur elementaren Affinität des benannten Zieles ein.

>>Beispiel:

/magiadefensiv <t>

Stellt die Magia-Tafel passend zur elementaren Affinität des anvisierten Zieles ein.

/magiaauto

VERWENDUNG:

/magiaauto [Unterbefehl]

→ Aktiviert oder deaktiviert den Automatikmodus der Magia-Tafel. Solange der Automatikmodus aktiv ist, wird die elementare Ausrichtung der Magia-Tafel automatisch an das Ziel angepasst.

>>Unterbefehle:

  <UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>ang<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> (attack): Die automatische Anpassung erfolgt offensiv.

  <UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>ver<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> (defense): Die automatische Anpassung erfolgt defensiv.

  <UIForeground>F201FA</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FB</UIGlow>aus<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> (off): Deaktiviert den Automatikmodus.

Bei fehlendem Unterbefehl werden die Einstellungsoptionen der Reihe nach durchgeschaltet.

>>Beispiel:

/magiaauto offensiv

Aktiviert den offensiven Automatikmodus.

/weltenkontaktkreis1, /wkk1, /cwlinkshell1, /cwl1

VERWENDUNG:

/wkk1 [Nachr.]

→ Sendet eine Nachricht an alle Mitglieder des Welten-Kontaktkreises, dem du Slot 1 zugewiesen hast. Die Entfernung spielt keine Rolle.

Wenn kein Text eingegeben wird, wechselt das Chatlog zum Reiter „Welten-Kontaktkreis 1“.



Beispiel:

/wkk1 Guten Morgen!

Sendet die Chat-Nachricht „Guten Morgen!“ an alle Mitglieder des Welten-Kontaktkreises 1.

/wkk1

Wechselt den aktiven Reiter des Chatlogs zu „Welten-Kontaktkreis 1“.
